text: As we come together to declare our vision as Democrats, we are mindful that the challenges of our times are new and profound.
This November, the choice we face as Americans may have more impact on our people and our place in the world than any in our lifetimes.

We approach this task with a seriousness that matches the challenges before us, but also with a profound optimism about our future - an optimism that springs from our great faith in America, and our great pride in what it means to be Americans.
We know the stakes are immeasurably high.
For the first time in generations, we have been attacked on our own shores.
Our brave men and women in uniform are still in harm's way in Iraq, Afghanistan, and the war against terror.
Our alliances are frayed, our credibility in doubt.
Our great middle class is hard-pressed.
label: middle class and prof. groups

text: Millions of Americans have lost their jobs, and millions more are struggling under the mounting burden of life's everyday costs.
label: middle class and prof. groups

text: In Washington, the President and his allies stubbornly press on, without regard to the needs of our people or the challenges of our times.
It is time for a new direction.
John Kerry, John Edwards and the Democratic Party bring a new vision for America - strong at home, respected abroad.
An America that offers opportunity, rewards responsibility, and rejoices in diversity.
We have a plan to build a strong, respected America: protecting our people, rebuilding our alliances, and leading the way to a more peaceful and prosperous world.
We have a plan to build a strong, growing economy: creating good jobs, rewarding hard work, and restoring fiscal discipline.
label: economic planning

text: We have a plan to help our people build strong, healthy families: securing quality health care, offering world-class education, and ensuring clean air and water.
And we will honor the values of a strong American community: widening the circle of equality, protecting the sanctity of freedom, and deepening our commitment to this country.
label: freedom & human rights

text: In offering this vision, we affirm our faith in the greatness of America.
We recommit to the ideal of a people united in helping one another, an ideal as old as the faiths we follow and as great as the country we love.
To those who are threatened, we pledge protection; to those who are victims, we promise justice; to those who are hopeless, we offer hope.
And to all Americans who seek a better future for themselves, for their loved ones, and for our country, we say: your cause is our own.
That is the America we believe in.
That is the America we are fighting for.
That is the America we will build together - one nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.
Alone among nations, America was born in pursuit of an idea - that a free people with diverse beliefs could govern themselves in peace.

text: One hundred and fifty years ago, Americans who had gathered to protest the expansion of slavery gave birth to a political Party that would save the Union - the Republican Party.
In 1860, Abraham Lincoln of Illinois carried the Republican banner in the Presidential election and was elected the Party's first President.
He became our nation's greatest leader … and one of our Party's greatest heroes.
Every day, we strive to fulfill Lincoln's vision: a country united and free, in which all people are guaranteed equal rights and the opportunity to pursue their dreams.
His legacy goes beyond the borders of America.
It can be seen in free governments all over the world.
Lincoln's successors have been united by a common purpose - defending freedom at home and promoting it abroad.
Today, the Republican Party gathers to renominate a man who carries on the best traditions of our Party by carrying the banner of freedom.

text: His forward-looking strategy for freedom and peace is making progress in every part of the world.
label: political authority

text: The President and Republicans in Congress recognize that new threats demand new tools and new methods for defending America and promoting our goals in the world.
label: political authority

text: They have responded swiftly to the challenges of a new era, rather than remaining wedded to outdated theories and fighting battles that ended long ago.
label: political authority

text: Their accomplishments are the foundation upon which future progress will be built.
label: political authority

text: The world changed on September 11, 2001, and since that day, under the strong, steady, and visionary leadership of President George W. Bush, Americans have helped make the world not only safer, but better.
label: political authority

text: The President continues to lead a steady, confident, systematic campaign to defend America against the dangers of our time.
label: law and order +

text: We are going after terrorists wherever they plot and plan and hide, changing the old course of pinprick strikes that did little to get at the root of terrorism.
label: law and order +

text: We eliminated many of al Qaeda's key leaders and put the world on notice that nations that train, harbor, or finance terrorists are just as guilty as the terrorists themselves.
label: law and order +

text: We will not allow the world's most dangerous regimes to possess the world's most dangerous weapons.
label: law and order +

text: Our message is getting through, as indicated by Libya's leader, who decided to turn over his weapons of mass destruction and cooperate with the international community.
label: law and order +

text: Today, because America has acted, and because America has led, the forces of terror and tyranny have suffered defeat after defeat, and America and the world are safer.
label: law and order +

text: On September 11, 2001, we saw the cruelty of the terrorists, and we glimpsed the future they intend for us.
label: law and order +

text: They intend to strike the United States to the limits of their power.
label: law and order +

text: They seek weapons of mass destruction to kill Americans on an even greater scale.
label: law and order +

text: This danger is increased when outlaw regimes build or acquire weapons of mass destruction and maintain ties to terrorist groups.
label: law and order +

text: On September 11, 2001, we saw the spirit of courage and optimism of the American people - that greatest assurance of the ultimate triumph of our cause.
label: law and order +

text: Courage and optimism led colleagues to help each other in escaping from collapsing buildings.
label: law and order +

text: Courage and optimism led policemen, firefighters, emergency medical professionals, public works employees, our men and women in uniform, and selfless volunteers to run into burning buildings to save others and undertake a mammoth rescue and recovery effort.
label: law and order +

text: Courage and optimism led the passengers on Flight 93 to rush their murderers to save lives on the ground.
label: law and order +

text: Courage and optimism led America's parents and teachers to battle their own fears to keep children calm and safe.
label: law and order +

text: In those and countless other acts of heroism on that day, and many times since, terrorists have learned that Americans will not be intimidated.
label: law and order +

text: We will fight them with everything we have - and we will prevail.
label: law and order +

text: President Bush answered the challenge of September 11, 2001, not only with steadfast resolve, but also with vision, optimism, and unshakable confidence in the will and faith of the American people.
label: political authority

text: That is what we all saw on September 14, 2001, when our President stood with the brave workers at Ground Zero and resolutely assured our nation amidst our shock, anger, and grief that while the terrorists had struck first, America would have the last word.
label: political authority

text: The President's most solemn duty is to protect our country.
label: political authority

text: George W. Bush has kept that charge.
label: political authority

text: To protect our people, President Bush is leading America, staying on the offensive against threats within our own country.
label: political authority

text: He worked with Congress to establish the Department of Homeland Security in the most significant reorganization of the federal government since 1947.
label: political authority

text: The PATRIOT Act is being used to track terrorist activity and to break up terror cells.
label: law and order +

text: Now, the FBI can use tools that have been long available to fight organized crime and drug trafficking, but could not be used in the past to fight terrorism.
label: law and order +

text: Intelligence and law enforcement officials are sharing information as never before.
label: law and order +

text: The President transformed the mission of the FBI to focus first and foremost on preventing terrorism.
label: law and order +

text: Every element of America's homeland security plan is critical, because the terrorists are ruthless and resourceful - and we know they are preparing to attack us again.
label: law and order +

text: It is not possible to guarantee perfect security in our vast, free nation.
label: law and order +

text: But the President and Vice President, along with many fine professionals in intelligence, homeland security, law enforcement, and the military are working tirelessly to protect the country.
label: law and order +

text: We are grateful to them all.
label: law and order +

text: President Bush recognized that to overcome the dangers of our time, America would have to take a new approach in the world.
label: political authority

text: That approach is marked by a determination to challenge new threats, not ignore them, or simply wait for future tragedy - and by a renewed commitment to building a hopeful future in hopeless places, instead of allowing troubled regions to remain in despair and explode in violence.
label: political authority

text: Before entering office, President Bush recognized that our age is a time of opportunity for America - opportunity to translate this moment of influence into decades of peace, prosperity, and liberty.
label: internationalism +

text: That conviction is in the finest traditions of the Republican Party.
label: internationalism +

text: As our platform said in 1984, during the height of Cold War confrontation: "The supreme purpose of our foreign policy must be to maintain our freedom in a peaceful international environment in which the United States and our allies and friends are secure against military threats, and democratic governments are flourishing in a world of increasing prosperity.”
label: internationalism +

text: The reality of 9/11 does not diminish our generation's opportunity to advance the cause of freedom but in fact makes it all the more important that we take up that challenge.
label: internationalism +

text: President Bush has rallied America to its calling - to make the world safer and better.
label: internationalism +

text: This calling is answered by a distinctly American internationalism that reflects the union of our values and our national interests.
label: internationalism +

text: Americans everywhere are remaining faithful to that duty.
label: internationalism +

text: By keeping our word and holding firm to our values, this generation is showing the world the power of liberty once again.
label: internationalism +

text: Republicans support President Bush's steadfast commitment to the goal of a lasting, democratic peace, in which all nations are free from the threat of sudden terror.
label: democracy

text: We affirm the three commitments of the President's strategy for peace:
label: peace

text: • Terrorists long ago declared war on America, and now America has declared war against terrorists.
label: military +

text: We are defending the peace by taking the fight to the enemy.
label: military +

text: We are confronting terrorists overseas so we do not have to confront them here at home.
label: military +

text: We are destroying the leadership of terrorist networks in sudden raids, disrupting their planning and financing, and keeping them on the run.
label: military +

text: Month by month, we are shrinking the space in which they can freely operate, by denying them territory and the support of governments.
label: military +

text: •Nations that support terrorism are just as dangerous, and just as guilty, as the perpetrators of terrorism.
label: foreign special +

text: Every nation must make a choice to support terror or to support America and our coalition to defeat terror.
label: foreign special +

text: We are preserving the peace by working with more than 80 allied nations, as well as international institutions, to isolate and confront terrorists and outlaw regimes.
label: foreign special +

text: America is leading a broad coalition of nations to disrupt proliferation.
label: internationalism +

text: We are working with the United Nations, the International Atomic Energy Agency, and other international organizations to take action in our common security.
label: internationalism +

text: The global threat of terrorism requires a global response.
label: military +

text: To be effective, that global response requires leadership - and America is leading.
label: military +

text: •There is no negotiation with terrorists.
label: democracy

text: No form of therapy or coercion will turn them from their murderous ways.
label: democracy

text: Only total and complete destruction of terrorism will allow freedom to flourish.
label: democracy

text: We will extend the peace by supporting the rise of democracy, and the hope and progress that democracy brings, as the alternative to hatred and terror in the broader Middle East.
label: democracy

text: In democratic societies, men and women do not swear allegiance to malcontents and murderers; they turn their hearts and labor to building better lives.
label: democracy

text: Democratic governments do not shelter terrorist camps or attack their neighbors.
label: democracy

text: When justice and democracy advance, so does the hope of lasting peace.
label: democracy

text: We are proud of the President's steady leadership in executing this strategy.
label: political authority

text: We are dealing with terrorist threats as they gather, rather than waiting for them to become imminent dangers.
label: political authority

text: The results are clear to see.
label: political authority

text: •Three years ago, our nation was not on a war footing against al Qaeda - even though Osama bin Laden declared war on the United States in 1996 and again in 1998.
label: law and order +

text: The al Qaeda leadership believed itself to be impervious to any American response, continued to raise funds practically without restriction, and operated in a world in which there was no cohesive global approach to fighting terror.
label: law and order +

text: Today, al Qaeda has been wounded, having lost many of its known leaders and most of its important sanctuaries.
label: law and order +

text: America and its allies and friends have broken al Qaeda cells here in the United States and overseas.
label: law and order +

text: A global coalition, led by the United States, has dried up sources of terrorist financing.
label: foreign special +

text: Thousands of very skilled and determined military personnel remain on the manhunt, going after the remaining killers who hide in cities and caves.
label: military +

text: Today, because of the solidarity of the international coalition in the War on Terror, we are bringing these terrorists to justice, and the American people are safer.
label: foreign special +

text: •Three years ago, al Qaeda's secure home base was in Afghanistan, a country ruled by the Taliban, one of the most backward and brutal regimes of modern history.
label: law and order +

text: Schooling was denied to girls.
label: law and order +

text: Women were whipped and executed in public.
label: law and order +

text: Millions lived in fear.
label: law and order +

text: With protection from the Taliban, al Qaeda and its associates trained, indoctrinated, and sent forth thousands of killers to set up terror cells in dozens of countries, including our own.
label: law and order +

text: Today, Afghanistan is a world away from the nightmare of the Taliban.
label: freedom & human rights

text: Twentyeight million people are free.
label: freedom & human rights

text: That country has a good and just president.
label: freedom & human rights

text: Boys and girls are being educated.
label: freedom & human rights

text: Women are respected.
label: freedom & human rights

text: Many refugees have returned home to rebuild their country, and a presidential election is scheduled for this fall.
label: freedom & human rights

text: The terror camps are closed and the Afghan government is helping us to hunt the Taliban and terrorists in remote regions.
label: law and order +

text: Today, because we acted to liberate Afghanistan, a threat has been removed, and the American people are safer.
label: law and order +

text: •Three years ago, Pakistan was one of the few countries in the world that recognized the Taliban regime.
label: foreign special -

text: Al Qaeda was active and recruiting in Pakistan.
label: foreign special -

text: Pakistan served as a transit point for al Qaeda terrorists leaving Afghanistan on missions of murder.
label: foreign special -

text: The United States could not count on the support of Pakistan's military and civilian leaders - the very people we would need to help shut down al Qaeda operations in that part of the world.
label: foreign special -

text: Today, the governments of the United States and Pakistan are working closely in the fight against terror.
label: foreign special +

text: Pakistan has helped capture Khalid Sheik Mohammed, the operational planner behind the September 11 attacks, and other terrorists.
label: foreign special +

text: Pakistani forces are rounding up terrorists along their nation's western border.
label: foreign special +

text: Today, because we are working with Pakistani leaders, Pakistan is an ally in the War on Terror, and the American people are safer.
label: foreign special +

text: •Three years ago, terrorists were well-established in Saudi Arabia.
label: foreign special -

text: Inside that country, fundraisers and other facilitators gave al Qaeda financial and logistical help with little scrutiny or opposition.
label: foreign special -

text: Today, after the attacks in Riyadh and elsewhere, the Saudi government knows that al Qaeda is its enemy.
label: foreign special +

text: Saudi Arabia is working hard to shut down the facilitators and financial supporters of terrorism.
label: foreign special +

text: The government has captured or killed many first-tier leaders of the al Qaeda organization in Saudi Arabia.
label: foreign special +

text: Today, because Saudi Arabia has seen the danger and has joined the War on Terror, the American people are safer.
label: foreign special +

text: •Three years ago, the ruler of Iraq was a sworn enemy of America who provided safe haven for terrorists, used weapons of mass destruction, and turned his nation into a prison.
label: foreign special -

text: Saddam Hussein was not just a dictator; he was a proven mass murderer who refused to account for weapons of mass murder.
label: foreign special -

text: He defied the international community and seventeen United Nations resolutions over the course of twelve years, giving no indication that Iraq would ever disarm and comply with the just demands of the world.
label: foreign special -

text: In 2002 - in Resolution 1441 - the United Nations Security Council unanimously voted that Saddam Hussein had one final chance to comply with his obligations to the international community, or there would be serious consequences.
label: foreign special -

text: As he had for over a decade, he refused to comply.
label: foreign special -

text: Every responsible nation recognized this threat, and knew it could not go on forever.
label: foreign special -

text: Today, the dictator who caused decades of death and turmoil, who twice invaded his neighbors, who harbored terrorist leaders, who used chemical weapons on innocent men, women, and children, finally stands before the bar of justice.
label: law and order +

text: Iraq, which once had the worst government in the Middle East, is now becoming an example of reform to the region.
label: law and order +

text: Iraqi security forces are fighting beside coalition troops to defeat the terrorists and foreign fighters who threaten their nation and the world.
label: law and order +

text: Today, because America and our coalition helped to end the violent regime of Saddam Hussein, and because we are helping to raise a peaceful democracy in its place, 25 million Iraqis are free and the American people are safer.
label: law and order +

text: •Three years ago, the nation of Libya, a longtime supporter of terror, was spending millions to acquire chemical and nuclear weapons.
label: foreign special -

text: Today, thousands of Libya's chemical munitions have been destroyed.
label: foreign special +

text: Libya's nuclear equipment that could ultimately have threatened the lives of hundreds of thousands is stored away in the United States.
label: foreign special +

text: Today, because the Libyan government saw the seriousness of the civilized world, and correctly judged its own interests, the American people are safer.
label: foreign special +

text: •Three years ago, a private weapons proliferation network was doing business around the world.
label: law and order +

text: This network, operated by the Pakistani nuclear scientist A.Q. Khan, was selling nuclear plans and equipment to the highest bidder, and found willing buyers in places like Libya, Iran, and North Korea.
label: law and order +

text: Today, the A.Q. Khan network is out of business.
label: law and order +

text: We have ended one of the most dangerous sources of proliferation in the world, and the American people are safer.
label: law and order +

text: Republicans applaud President Bush, Vice President Cheney, and those who have supported them in the Congress for the steady leadership that led to these successes.
label: law and order +

text: America must stay the course.
label: law and order +

text: In Afghanistan and Iraq, our enemies have seen the results of what civilized nations can, and will, do against regimes that harbor, support, and use terrorism to achieve their political goals.
label: democracy

text: Republicans believe that America and the world must keep our commitments to the people of those countries, who are building the world's newest democracies and counting on the world to help.
label: democracy

text: Delivering these nations from tyranny has required sacrifice and loss.
label: democracy

text: We must honor that sacrifice by finishing the great work we have begun.
label: democracy

text: Republicans appreciate the military, financial, and technical assistance provided by the dozens of nations contributing to the reconstruction of Afghanistan and Iraq.
label: foreign special +

text: The success of free and stable governments in Afghanistan, Iraq, and elsewhere will further shrink the space in which terrorists can operate.
label: law and order +

text: As the entire region sees the promise of freedom in its midst, the terrorist ideology will become more and more irrelevant, until that day when it is viewed with contempt or ignored altogether.
label: law and order +

text: The forces of many nations are working with Afghans to find and defeat Taliban remnants and eliminate al Qaeda terrorists.
label: military +

text: We applaud the work of American forces and coalition partners in helping to build the new Afghan national army and to train new Afghan police and border patrol.
label: military +

text: Together, Afghan and international forces will maintain the peace, secure Afghanistan's borders, and deny terrorists any foothold in that country.
label: military +

text: We applaud President Bush's announcement of U.S. support for five new initiatives that will help the Afghan people achieve the peace, stability, and prosperity they deserve - through support for the development of democracy, educational assistance, cultural exchanges, enhanced bilateral economic ties, and increased economic opportunity for women.
label: freedom & human rights

text: The road ahead for Afghanistan is still long and difficult.
label: democracy

text: Yet the Afghan people can know that their country will never be abandoned to terrorists and killers.
label: democracy

text: The world and the United States look forward to elections this year in Afghanistan and stand with the Afghan people as partners in their quest for peace and prosperity, stability, and democracy.
label: democracy

text: As Republicans, we do not equivocate, as others have done, about whether America should have gone to war in Iraq.
label: military +

text: The best intelligence available at the time indicated that Saddam Hussein was a threat.
label: military +

text: On that point, President Bush, members of both parties in Congress, and the United Nations agreed.
label: military +

text: While the stockpiles of weapons of mass destruction we expected to find in Iraq have not yet materialized, we have confirmed that Saddam Hussein had the capability to reconstitute his weapons programs and the desire to do so.
label: military +

text: Our nation did the right thing, and the American people are now safer because we and our allies ended the brutal dictatorship of Saddam Hussein, halting his decades-long pursuit of chemical, biological, and nuclear weapons.
label: military +

text: President Bush had a choice to make: Trust a madman or defend America.
label: military +

text: He chose defending America.
label: military +

text: Supported by brave coalition allies such as the United Kingdom, Australia, Italy, Poland, and Denmark,
label: foreign special +

text: and displaying courage, skill, and resourcefulness on the battlefield, the men and women of our Armed Forces removed the dictator of Iraq, a declared enemy of America who had the capability and intent to produce weapons of mass murder, and could have passed that capability to terrorists bent on killing Americans.
label: military +

text: That was a risk we could not take.
label: military +

text: America's men and women in uniform have been unrelenting in the performance of their duty.
label: military +

text: Our nation has asked much of our military, and there is still much hard work ahead.
label: military +

text: We are proud of the sacrifice made by all who have served and are serving, and we are immensely grateful for the sacrifices made by their families and loved ones.
label: military +

text: Further, we honor the memories of those who have died in combat serving the cause of freedom.
label: military +

text: Defending our homeland with their ultimate sacrifice on behalf of all Americans merits our prayers and our thanksgiving.
label: military +

text: We also commit to continued honor and care for our wounded veterans, and support for all who return home from service.
label: military +

text: Together, we look forward to that day when the War on Terror is won and our military can return home, no longer at risk, our world and our country safer.
label: military +

text: We also salute our coalition allies.
label: foreign special +

text: Their efforts with us to shape a world where freedom is honored and liberty is cherished deserves respect and admiration; their sacrifice, too, does not go without notice and appreciation.
label: foreign special +

text: We are ever mindful that American troops remain on the ground in Iraq, working steadfastly to help the Iraqi people achieve stability and democracy.
label: military +

text: We therefore welcome declarations from responsible political leaders of both parties that our nation will persevere in our mission there, not cut and run.
label: military +

text: The American people need to hear this message.
label: military +

text: People in Baghdad and beyond need to hear it.
label: military +

text: The enemy needs to hear it.
label: military +

text: Most importantly, American soldiers, sailors, airmen, and Marines risking their lives in Iraq need to hear it.
label: military +

text: We condemn inconsistent, ambiguous, and politically expedient statements on that point.
label: political authority

text: To the extent such wavering encourages our adversaries to fight harder, our men and women in uniform suffer the consequences.
label: political authority

text: Their mission is difficult enough.
label: political authority

text: Uncertainty about America's commitment to that mission makes it immeasurably more difficult.
label: political authority

text: In Iraq, America is serving the cause of liberty, peace, and our own security.

text: America accepted a difficult task in Iraq.
label: law and order +

text: We know that for all these reasons, we will finish that task.
label: law and order +

text: We also know that Iraqi sovereignty is a tribute to the will of the Iraqi people and the courage of Iraqi leaders.
label: foreign special +

text: It is a proud moral achievement for members of our coalition.
label: foreign special +

text: We have full confidence in the plan for Iraqi self-government that is currently being implemented by Iraq's interim government.

label: foreign special +

text: The United States and our coalition partners are helping prepare Iraqis for the defense of their own country, including through the work of the NATO mission to train Iraqi security forces.
label: foreign special +

text: We are helping Iraqis rebuild their country's infrastructure, and Iraq is continuing to move toward free elections, with important assistance from the United Nations.
label: military +

text: We applaud President Bush for establishing a visionary and resolute policy - a Forward Strategy of Freedom in the Middle East - to stand with the people of that region as they seek their future in freedom.
label: political authority

text: Republicans support President Bush's policy of working with every government in the Middle East dedicated to destroying the terrorist networks, while in the longer term expecting a higher standard of reform and democracy from our friends in the region.
label: political authority

text: We believe that democracy and reform will make those nations stronger and more stable, and make the world more secure by undermining terrorism at its source.
label: political authority

label: foreign special +

text: We applaud the commitment of the world's leading industrial nations to this historic initiative to support political, economic, and social reform throughout the region.
label: foreign special +

text: Republicans agree with the Bush Administration that there is no greater danger to our people than the nexus of terrorists and weapons of mass destruction (WMD).
label: law and order +

label: law and order +

text: Libya's decision to disclose and dismantle its WMD programs is a product of the President's strategy that gives regimes a choice.
label: foreign special +

text: They can choose to pursue WMD at great peril and cost, including international isolation.
label: foreign special +

text: Or they can choose to renounce these weapons, take steps to rejoin the international community, and have its help in creating a better future for their citizens.
label: foreign special +

text: The Libya case also demonstrates the President's success in forging increased international cooperation to prevent the spread of WMD technology through his groundbreaking Proliferation Security Initiative, a broad international partnership to coordinate actions to interdict proliferation shipments of WMD and related materials and shut down proliferation networks and entities.

text: Republicans applaud the support of more than 60 nations in this crucial multilateral effort to stop the trade in weapons of mass destruction and their related components.
label: internationalism +

text: We commend the President's leadership in expanding greatly the resources to prevent proliferation, including record-level U.S. and multilateral resources devoted to the Nunn-Lugar programs and other nonproliferation assistance, including that made available through the creation of the G-8 Global Partnership, which will provide $20 billion to this effort over 10 years.

text: Republicans share President Bush's understanding that in an age in which the enemies of civilization openly and actively seek the world's most destructive technologies, the United States cannot remain idle while dangers gather.
label: political authority

text: We therefore believe that to forestall or prevent hostile acts by our adversaries, the United States must, if necessary, act preemptively.

label: foreign special +

text: In the fight against terror, America has asked our allies to do hard things.

label: foreign special +

text: " Directing ugly rhetoric at America's allies in a time of war is irresponsible.

text: Just as the Cold War prompted a massive reorganization of the federal government's foreign policy apparatus, the War on Terror demanded a thorough reorganization of America's domestic preparedness agencies.
label: law and order +

text: President Bush led this effort with a plan to merge 22 separate government entities into the new Department of Homeland Security, a cohesive department with the primary mission of keeping America safe.
label: law and order +

text: After the American people returned control of the Senate to Republicans in the 2002 mid-term elections, Congress passed legislation enacting the President's plan.

text: Further, to ensure that America's law enforcement, intelligence, and first responders have the resources they need to protect America, President Bush and Congress have nearly tripled homeland security funding since 2001.

text: • The Treasury Department is now leading the effort to find and eliminate sources of terrorist financing around the world.

text: •expand bioterror research by an even greater margin, from $53 million in 2001 to $1. 7 billion in 2005, an increase of more than 3,100 percent;

text: •increase the size of the Strategic National Stockpile of vaccines and countermeasures by 50 percent since 2001; and

label: law and order +

text: We know what brought us this success - the hard work of the American people and the Republican commitment to low taxes.

text: Now we must keep our economy on the right path by preventing taxes on families from going up next year, making the tax relief of the last four years permanent, and reforming the tax code to make it simpler, fairer, and more growth-oriented.

text: To make sure the private sector has the capital it needs to invest, grow the economy, and expand prosperity, our leaders must make sure that the growth of the federal government remains in check.
label: economic planning

text: The challenges America has faced over the last four years have created an unwelcome but manageable budget deficit.
label: economic planning

text: These deficits are due to a number of factors: the stock market downturn that began in 2000 and the subsequent recession that President Bush inherited when he took office; the terrorist attacks on America and the necessary spending for homeland security and the War on Terror those attacks precipitated; and the crisis in confidence produced by corporate scandals that were years in the making.
label: economic planning

text: It is important to view the size of the deficit in relation to the size of the nation's economy.
label: economic planning

text: By that measure, today's deficit, although unwelcome, is well within historical ranges.
label: economic planning

text: A deficit that is 3. 8 percent of GDP, as is now projected for this year, would be smaller than the deficits in nine of the last 25 years, and far below the peak deficit figure of 6 percent of GDP reached in 1983.
label: economic planning

text: This deficit is also in line with what other industrialized nations are facing today.
label: economic planning

text: The U. S. deficit matches the average deficit within the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, and is below the levels of France, Germany, and Japan.
label: economic planning

text: Much more importantly, because the President and Congress enacted pro-growth economic policies, the deficit is headed strongly in the right direction.
label: economic planning

text: Next year's projected deficit, at 2. 7 percent of GDP, would be smaller than those in 14 of the last 25 years.
label: economic planning

text: As Republicans in Congress work with the President to restrain spending and strengthen economic growth, the federal deficit will fall to 1. 5 percent of the nation's economic output in 2009 - well below the 2. 2 percent average of the last 40 years.
label: economic planning

text: The events that brought us into deficit are not completely behind us.
label: economic planning

text: The War on Terror goes on.
label: economic planning

text: Republicans are committed to winning the War on Terror and will continue to implement policies that promote jobs, investment, and growth in every region of the country and every sector of our economy.
label: economic planning

text: Time and again, he has made difficult decisions and followed through with clear determination.
label: economic planning

text: He has made it plain that his top budgetary priority is to protect America and win the War on Terror.
label: economic planning

text: He also remains committed to the education reforms he spearheaded in 2001.

label: economic planning

text: We support a cap on discretionary spending that will limit the growth of overall spending while ensuring that priorities such as our nation's security will continue to be met.

text: We applaud President Bush for submitting a budget for 2005 that provides significant increases in funding to win the War on Terror and protect the homeland, while limiting the growth in all other non-security related discretionary spending to less than one percent.
label: economic planning

text: To further the goal of respecting taxpayers' dollars and restraining spending, we endorse the creation of a line-item veto, which the President could use consistent with the Constitution to reject new appropriations, new mandatory spending, or limited grants of tax benefits (to 100 or fewer beneficiaries) whenever he determines the spending or tax benefits are not essential priorities.
label: economic planning

text: Under this approach, all savings from the line-item veto would be used for deficit reduction, and could not be applied to other spending.
label: economic planning

text: Governors across the nation already have and use this tool to reduce unnecessary spending.
label: economic planning

text: The cost of providing health care for employees is a major burden for American businesses.

text: Health insurance costs for employers have been rising every year since 1996, causing businesses to hire fewer new employees and too many families to go without insurance.

text: Liberty to Captives: Combatting Human Trafficking

text: Facing 21st Century Threats:

text: Protection Against an Electromagnetic Pulse

label: military +

text: With North Korea in possession of nuclear missiles and Iran close to having them, an EMP is no longer a theoretical concern — it is a real threat.

text: Moreover, China and Russia include sabotage as part of their warfare planning.

text: Confronting Internet Tyranny

Internet firewall circumvention and anticensorship technology must become a national priority in light of the way authoritarian governments such as China, Cuba, and Iran restrict free press and isolate their people limiting political, cultural, and religious freedom.
label: freedom

text: Leaders of authoritarian governments argue that governments have the same legal right to control internet access as they do to control migrant access.
label: freedom

text: A focus on internet freedom is a cost-effective means of peacefully advancing fundamental freedoms in closed and authoritarian societies.

text: But it is also an important economic interest, as censorship constitutes a trade barrier for U.S. companies operating in societies like China with advanced firewall protection policies.
